title: Noam Chomsky on Carl Jung: Universal Grammar and Archetypes of the Collective Unconscious
description: Chomsky discusses Jung's theory of the unconscious, claims that Jung is a unique exception to a dogma still upheld: that there are some unconscious contents inaccessible to consciousness. Whether John Searle or Quine, most philosophers believe that mental contents are necessarily available to conscious awareness. Enjoy! #chomsky #philosophy #archetypes #unconsciousmind #unconsciousness #Jung #carljung #carljungquotes #universal #universalgrammar #psychology #consciousness #quine #searle
